The Elder Sīhāsanika’s Birth Story
“The Fortunate One Padumuttara,
who was benevolent to all beings;
with a confident and joyful mind,

analyzed: sīhāsana madāsaha  deva loke manusse vā
translated: I gave a lion throne.🔽Whether in the world of the gods or among humans,
wherever I lived,
I obtained abundant wealth,
this is the fruit of the lion throne.🔽Many couches made of gold, silver,
coral, and gems,
always appear to me.
Having made a seat for the Bodhi (Tree),
with the best of water birds,
I am reborn in a high family,
oh, the excellence of the Dhamma!
For a hundred thousand aeons,
I gave a lion throne;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of the lion throne.
My defilements have been burned up,
I live without pollutants.
Welcome indeed was it to me,
the Buddha’s instruction has been done.
The four analytical insights,
the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā sīhāsaniko thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā sīhāsanikaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus has the venerable elder Sīhāsanika recited these verses.
